intro: Disterigma margaricoccum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered disterigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Disterigma margaricoccum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
